channel.title: Hosting my own server?
channel.description: I do not atm have enough money to buy premium hosting, however i have a domain name, is it possible to have a server set up at home and run the website and database from there, and ill point the domain name to the IP? also what are my limits like what happens if i go over my monthly bandwidth .

item.title: Hosting my own server?
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

PM me and I’ll give you free hosting.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting my own server?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:4, topic:534544”]Get a job and you’ll make enough in a fortnight to buy hosting for a year. The method you’re going for is a bad choice from a home connection, very bad. Depending on the traffic it may slow down your internet vice versa with the website speed. I wouldn’t recommend it and I’m sure any other verified web dev would say so as well.[/quote]he wouldn’t even need a job; he’d be making a £70 saving by not having to pay the power bill for that server. unless mummy is paying ofc.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting my own server?
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Get a job and you’ll make enough in a fortnight to buy hosting for a year. The method you’re going for is a bad choice from a home connection, very bad. Depending on the traffic it may slow down your internet vice versa with the website speed. I wouldn’t recommend it and I’m sure any other verified web dev would say so as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting my own server?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

I wouldn’t bother tbh, I did this for a few years and it was the most unreliable shit I’ve ever used. The webserver stack had memory leaks, the ISP router was shit and always crashed, and the connection was always dropping. The upload speed was also terrible, and the latency was huge with massive jitter.

You can get budget webhosting for like £30/yr and it’ll be much more reliable than hosting from home. It’s also worth thinking about the power cost… a 100W server will likely cost you around £100/yr to run.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting my own server?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

http://www.wampserver.com/en/

There’ll be a few more things you’ll have to look into to getting the domain to point to your home server.

https://www.google.com/search?q=dns+on+home+server&oq=dns+on+home+server&aqs=chrome..69i57j0l3.7046j0j1&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8
Might help you.

Your bandwidth depends on your ISP, obviously. Some ISPs frown upon running servers from home, but I’m sure you won’t attract enough volume to piss them off.

Read full topic
